author: Reuters Editorial
title: China's top leadership approves new asset management regulation: state media
text:
BEIJING (Reuters) - China’s President Xi Jinping and other top officials met to discuss and approve new regulation for the country’s asset management sector, state radio reported on Wednesday.
FILE PHOTO - Chinese President Xi Jinping walks to deliver his speech at the closing session of the National People's Congress (NPC) at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing, China March 20, 2018. REUTERS/Damir Sagolj The radio report said the officials said new rules should offer unified standards for regulatory oversight and offer equal market access and supervision but did not offer further details, including what the new rules will call for.
The officials also approved new rules on non-financial sector’s investment in financial companies, the report said without elaborating further.
Reporting by Se Young Lee and Lusha Zhang; Editing by Richard Borsuk
